(Gee thanks)
::Shadow Wing::

She stayed in the tree.  She could use the daggers, but he would 
still have the upper hand on physical strength. She needed an 
equalizer to make things more even.  But she didn't want to hurt him 
in the prossess.  She flew to another tree a few yards off and 
perched high in the branches.  She figured if she waited, he would 
show her how to win. She took out a stone and tossed it at him.


--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> "Slag I missed again." Lunarpine watched her fly to tree number 
two, 
> heard the hoot and saw her head in the direction of the third tree 
> before seemingly vanishing in the thick branches and leaves. He 
moved 
> right and cut through some thick bushes.
> He opened his comm "What's the matter birdie you afraid to take me 
> claw to claw, I'll even let you use your daggers if you want." 
> Transforming back to wolf mode he stayed low. He could easily pick 
> her off with a rifle blast, but that would defeat the purpose of 
the 
> sparring.
> (Much better Logo.)
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> > :Shadow Wing::
> > 
> > She stayed hovering up over the fallen tree.  She knew he could 
see 
> > her now.  So she flew over to another tree and perched.  She 
hooted 
> > at him. She figured she would be nice and let him know where she 
> was.
> > 
> > She knew that she couldn't compete physically with him, so why 
not 
> > have some fun before getting her tail feathers kicked.
> > 
> > She hooted a few more time and flew to another tree. She perched 
on 
> a 
> > high branch with thick foliage. Only this time,she held perfectly 
> > still and didn't make a sound.
